text: The Wright Eclipse Fusion was a articulated single-decker body of a bus. It had three-axles and it had a low floor. It was made from 1999 to 2005 by Wrightbus. The Wright Eclipse Fusion body was built on the Volvo B7LA chassis. == Operators == From 2000 to 2005, First Aberdeen and First West of England ordered 67 Wright Eclipse Fusions. From 2000 to 2005, First Glasgow, First West Yorkshire and First Hampshire & Dorset ordered 37 Wright Eclipse Fusions. In 2000, Dublin Bus ordered 21 Wright Eclipse Fusions for services in Northern Ireland. In October 2001, 2 Wright Eclipse Fusions were sent from First Hampshire & Dorset to First London to operate a six-month trial on route 207. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Low-floor buses Eclipse Fusion Category:Articulated buses
title: Wright Eclipse Fusion
